Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

GENERAL NOTE: There are a number of messages in this mission wher a character is pretending to be another character. This is done through advanced holo technology of the Shakarn and will display in game the different portraits of the imitated characters together with the name of the person that is in disguise. For each of these instances there will be a remark in the localization notes for which character is talking and who he impersonates.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector. "Rift Reactor" refers to the facility complex that this sector is a part of.
Name of a unique world map sector. "Rift Reactor" refers to the facility complex that this sector is a part of.
Name of a unique world map sector. "Rift Reactor" refers to the facility complex that this sector is a part of.
Name of a unique world map sector. "Rift Reactor" refers to the facility complex that this sector is a part of.
Name of a unique world map sector. "Rift Reactor" refers to the facility complex that this sector is a part of.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector. "Deer" is the name of a Therian character, see the corresponding entry in the Glossary.
Victory Condition: Striking from the Shadows
A header name of a task.

You can win this map by locating and sabotaging the ELOP Rift Reactor that's keeping the Shakarn fleet from invading through the Void. Completing this mission will be much easier while your enemies do not realize what they are up against, so it is vital to keep your human cover intact.[br/][br/]Reactor Stability: {INT_0}%[br/]Cover Compromised: {INT_1}%

A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'. "ELOP Rift Reactor" is the name used for the scientific complex composed of five in game Voidtech Complex landmarks, owned by the ELOP commanders present in the mission.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
A header name of a task.

Your cover has been blown. The Dvar and Vanguard commanders are assembling their troops for the defense. Only through a direct assault can you now still complete your mission.[br/][br/]Reactor Stability: {INT_0}%
A task description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

Scout the locations of the ELOP Rift Reactor to search for weak points in the defensive perimeter. Try to stay concealed and out of enemy vision to not risk compromising your cover.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: your Recon units have water concealment and can scout the shores of the enemy island. To scout further into the land, use the Deploy Monitor operation unlocked by the Area Surveillance society research.)[/recommendedcol]

A task description. "Recon" is the name of the in game Shakarn scout unit. "Water Concealment" is the name of an in game unit ability. "Deploy Monitor" is the name of a strategic operation in the game. "Area Surveillance" is the name of a research tech in the game.
A header name of a task.

Make your way to the Resonance Halls where past Shakarn agents left the recordings of their Star Union infiltration.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: This is an adventure quest. Make sure to bring an army when you move to the target location.)[/recommendedcol]
A task description. "Resonance Halls" is the name of an exploration site in the game.

We have touched down without any signs of detection. Good. Now, before we make any further moves, remember, Kudat: our cover is that we are an Amazon convoy carrying terraforming equipment. We were forced to land after getting hit by a Void Storm. So please no ‘shoot first, answer questions later’ if the enemy encounters us.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "Kudat" is the first name of "Kudat Rotak", a male Shakarn character.

Argh, you are insulting my memory, General! Of course I recall your long and elaborate scheme to keep these humans fooled until their last breath is drawn. Nonetheless, I must repeat what I said before, that this is a plan of cowards that can only hold us back for too long!
Story message. Speaker: "Kudat Rotak" (Shakarn, male) "General" is a military title of the Shakarn.

You may have spent the past years acting and thinking like a Zardas, but you are a Gama, {STR_LeaderName}. You are a leader of our people, so by the blood of Shazora, start leading! Our fleet is waiting on the other side of the Spacial Rifts. This is not a time to hide in the shadows. This is a time to be bold and claim victory!

Story message. Speaker: "Kudat Rotak" (Shakarn, male) "Zardas" is the name of a Shakarn caste, see the Shakarn glossary entry. "Gama" is the name of a Shakarn caste, see the Shakarn glossary entry. "Shazora" is the name of a mythological Shakarn figure, see the "Prokarn" and "Shazora" glossary entries.

You accuse me of behaving like a Zardas, and yet it is you who seems to have mingled too much with his Domok fighters, Marshal. Running into enemy lines without reason would be an unnecessary risk. But do not worry, if everything else fails, we can still resort to your method of brute force.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "Domok" is the name of a Shakarn caste, see the Shakarn glossary entry. "Marshal" is a military title of the Shakarn.

While we send out our scouts, we can seize another rare opportunity and explore the Resonance Halls built by the original Star Union infiltrators. According to our records, one of these witnesses of past Shakarn deeds must be located close to our landing position.

Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "Resonance Halls" is the name of an exploration site in the game. "Infiltrators" is the plural form of the name of a Shakarn in game unit.

Seeing the secret recordings of previous Shakarn agents out in the open like this is deliciously brilliant. The humans always took the layered shapes and patterns for a new type of decoration, a peculiar style of art if you will. Little did they realize that it all meant so much more…
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Clueless humans! Just like the time when we took the schematics of all their laser guns and sent them back home to Kadalos.[br/][br/]But can you hear that? (Kudat starts retracing one of the textured curves with his claw. Looking at the pattern produces a resonating noise in your mind.) This, General, is the sound of battle!
Story message. Speaker: "Kudat Rotak" (Shakarn, male) "Kadalos" is the name of the Shakarn home world, see the glossary entry.

You are right… The sonoscript reveals that there had been a fight on Celaudius-2 directly before the Cataclysm. Our agents were planning to assault a Cosmic Manipulation Complex and warn our home world of the impending catastrophe. I wonder why we never heard of this incident…

Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "Sonoscript" is the name of a pattern language used as scripture by the Shakarn. For more info, see the corresponding glossary entry. "Celaudius-2" is the name of the planet this mission plays on.
Then there is only one proper way to find out: march onto the field of glory and examine the scene of their heroic struggle!
The sonoscripts revealed the assault plans of old Shakarn agents from before the Cataclysm happend. Venture to the scene of their final struggle to find out what fate befell them in the end.
Search for signs of the Shakarn assault and clues to how it may have played out.

General! We have cleared the rubble and uncovered the mortal remains of thirteen of our agents. It looks like they were still caught in the server room when the shockwave from the Cataclysm hit Celaudius-2.
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Raider" (Shakarn unit, male)

Where they were fulfilling their steadfast duty, undoubtedly. Their heroic attempt to warn the Scarlet Scepter will long be remembered. We should give them a proper burial and honor their selfless sacrifice.
Story message. Speaker: "Kudat Rotak" (Shakarn, male) "Scarlet Scepter" is the name of the Shakarn government, see the corresponding glossary entry.

You could have also said that they were fools who blindly kept following orders when they really should have focused on their survival, Marshal. A good Zardas agent knows when it is time to lie low, and when it is time to rise up and fight.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

And a good Domok soldier knows that his companions depend on his courage and laser rifle to stand strong together. Mocking them for their loyalty would undermine the backbone of what makes the Shakarn military and empire strong.

I suppose you have a point, Marshal. Only with the combined strengths of both castes our people could achieve their greatest victories.[br/][br/]Let us add the final verse of those operatives’ lives to the sonoscript in the Resonance Halls. Once the war is over, it shall serve future Shakarn generations as a memorial.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Loyal or not, the fact is that these operatives failed in their mission and ended up dead and hence useless to the Scarlet Scepter. I will hand over their uniforms to the new Zardas recruits we’ve been training. It shall serve them as a reminder of what happens to those who try to be heroes at the wrong moment.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Let your colonies craft new sonoscript blocks to tell and honor the story of the Shakarn agent's last duty.
When viewed by a Shakarn, the patterns on these blocks will resonate in his mind, narrating the story of the fallen Shakarn agents of Celaudius-2.

When Prokarn and Shazora descended from the shattered Ethereal Stronghold to return to Kadalos, they gifted their descendants with fortitude, cunning and the untamable will to conquer. A will that eventually guided us up to the stars, looking for a species that could match the battle wits and prowess of the Shakarn.

Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Tactician" (Shakarn unit, male) "Prokarn" and "Shazora" are the names of mythological Shakarn figures, see the corresponding Glossary entries. "Ethereal Stronghold" is the name of the mythological Shakarn heaven.

Until we encountered the Star Union, a voracious hydra of a thousand planets, slowly encroaching on our territory. The thirteen men and women we honor today were part of the infiltration program that began in the era of First Chancellor Izka and will end after 538 years with the anticipated success of this – our – mission.
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Tactician" (Shakarn unit, male) "First Chancellor" is a military and political title of the Shakarn. "Izka" is the name of a female Shakarn character.

To commemorate their dedication and sacrifice – and that of the other sixty-two hundred agents employed during this operation – we place down these panels of sonoscript to let their names and deeds echo further through the eons of time.[br/][br/]Glory to the Shakarn!
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Tactician" (Shakarn unit, male)
I hate to interrupt you at such an early hour, General. But my Raiders have caught a human spy, skulking around our camps.[br/][br/]Should we interrogate her or kill her on the spot?
I hate to interrupt you at such an early hour, General. But my Raiders have caught a human spy, skulking around our camps.[br/][br/]Should we interrogate him or kill him on the spot?

Story message. Speaker: "Kudat Rotak" (Shakarn, male) "Raider" is the name of a Shakarn unit in the game. The referenced "human spy" is a character that is always of the opposite gender as "Naranga Od", so there needs to be an alternative text set up for whenever that character is referenced. (Alternative text is assuming that "Naranga Od" is female, so in that case the "human spy" is male)

No… let go, you dastardly creatures! I won’t stop shouting until you’ve returned to me my David! Oh, yes, I know that he’s here. First you abducted him from Atrium Beta and then you took him to this moon to do who knows what terrible things to him. But I’ve tracked you down and now I demand him back!

No… let go, you dastardly creatures! I won’t stop shouting until you’ve returned to me my Sarah! Oh, yes, I know that she’s here. First you abducted her from Atrium Beta and then you took her to this moon to do who knows what terrible things to her. But I’ve tracked you down and now I demand her back!

Story message. Speaker: "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od". "David" and "Sarah" are the first names of the Vanguard (male and female) characters that were married to "James/Jane Henkins" (always heterosexual marriage assumed). "Atrium Beta" is the name of a planet.

Hah! This human roars like a thundermaw, but she lacks the teeth to also bite. Do you realize, wimp, that I could crush your skull with the raw power of my hands?[br/][br/](Kudat starts lifting the helpless woman up with his right arm, slowly tightening his grasp.)

Hah! This human roars like a thundermaw, but he lacks the teeth to also bite. Do you realize, wimp, that I could crush your skull with the raw power of my hands?[br/][br/](Kudat starts lifting the helpless man up with his right arm, slowly tightening his grasp.)

Story message. Speaker: "Kudat Rotak" (Shakarn, male) "This human" references "James/Jane Henkins", a Vanguard character that is always of the opposite gender as "Naranga Od", so there needs to be an alternative text set up for whenever that character is referenced. (Alternative text is assuming that "Naranga Od" is female, so in that case it is "James Henkins" and male) "Thundermaw" is the name of an in game wildlife unit native to the Shakarn empire.

Enough, Marshal! We’re all aware of your capabilities. As for you, human, this is what will happen: we will wipe all sensor logs you took on Celaudius-2, and then you will leave on a long journey to visit some distant relative, which you will also announce to anyone it might concern. You live. Nobody searches for you and disturbs us. We all win, right?

Enough, Marshal! We’re all aware of your capabilities. As for you, human, this is what will happen: we will wipe all sensor logs you took on Celaudius-2. Then you will leave on a long journey to visit some distant relative, which you will also announce to anyone it might concern. You live. Nobody searches for you and disturbs us. We all win, right?

Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "Human" references "James/Jane Henkins", a Vanguard character that is always of the opposite gender as "Naranga Od", so there needs to be an alternative text set up for whenever that character is referenced. (Alternative text is assuming that "Naranga Od" is female, so in that case it is "James Henkins" and male)

No! I will never leave this planet without my David! I cannot lose him, not a second time… It was a miracle he returned from the claws of the Kir’Ko after they laid waste to Atrium Alpha. That’s when I knew I could never let anything happen to him again.

No! I will never leave this planet without my Sarah! I cannot lose her, not a second time… It was a miracle she returned from the claws of the Kir’Ko after they laid waste to Atrium Alpha. That’s when I knew I could never let anything happen to her again.

Story message. Speaker: "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od". "David" and "Sarah" are the names of the Vanguard (male and female) characters that were married to "James/Jane Henkins" (always heterosexual marriage assumed). "Atrium Alpha" is the name of a planet.

I offer you a chance to get out of this, you fool. The David you knew is long dead. What came back to you after his death was little more than an… illusion.[br/][br/](Speaking the last words, you activate your holo projector.)

I offer you a chance to get out of this, you fool. The Sarah you knew is long dead. What came back to you after her death was little more than an… illusion.[br/][br/](Speaking the last words, you activate your holo projector.)

Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "You fool" references "James/Jane Henkins", a Vanguard character that is always of the opposite gender as "Naranga Od", so there needs to be an alternative text set up for whenever that character is referenced. (Alternative text is assuming that "Naranga Od" is female, so in that case it is "James Henkins" and male)

Did you never wonder, how “your” David could escape the ever-vigilant eyes of the Kir’Ko swarm? Or why he changed so drastically, being reserved and more interested in your work than your marriage? You realize it now. You know it is the truth: I became David Henkins!

Did you never wonder, how “your” Sarah could escape the ever-vigilant eyes of the Kir’Ko swarm? Or why she changed so drastically, being reserved and more interested in your work than your marriage? You realize it now. You know it is the truth: I became Sarah Henkins!
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

The wimp has fainted. Good show, General. What shall we do with her now? I guess she won’t be of any more use to us, now that we know she had no backups. Feeding her seems like a waste of resources when the opposite could be done.

The wimp has fainted. Good show, General. What shall we do with him now? I guess he won’t be of any more use to us, now that we know he had no backups. Feeding him seems like a waste of resources when the opposite could be done.

Backups or not, we should be concerned with how easily a simple civilian could track us down by herself. There are some questions that need answering.[br/][br/]Oh, and one more thing, Marshal: given the fragile mental state of our guest, I suggest you leave any interrogations to my direct supervision.

Backups or not, we should be concerned with how easily a simple civilian could track us down by himself. There are some questions that need answering.[br/][br/]Oh, and one more thing, Marshal: given the fragile mental state of our guest, I suggest you leave any interrogations to my direct supervision.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

You are right, Marshal. Keeping her as an asset would serve no purpose. Ironic… there were many days when I desired to dispose of her as a symbolic relief for enduring all the sickening humans around me. But I never imagined it to eventually happen this way.

You are right, Marshal. Keeping him as an asset would serve no purpose. Ironic… there were many days when I desired to dispose of him as a symbolic relief for enduring all the sickening humans around me. But I never imagined it to eventually happen this way.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
A header name of a task.
Wait for the Shakarn food plant to complete its gruesome grinding process. It converts any organic material into condensed nutritious protein bars.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
The meat grinder has completed its last cycle, General. The foolish human will no longer disturb our mission.

Good. I don’t like keeping liabilities.[br/][br/]There are always those shameful stories of agents growing attached to their assets over time. Therefore, it is important to set an example and show the new trainees that deep infiltration is not about cuddling up with the enemy.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Wait for the human prisoner to recover. Afterwards attain some information on how it was possible to follow your party to Celaudius-2 without earlier detection.

A task description. "Human prisoner" is referencing the "James/Jane Henkins" character, so it needs to either have an alternate text filled in to cover both genders or get translated with a gender neutral term.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

You are recovering? Good. I have prepared a list of questions that need to be answered: where is the vessel that brought you to Celaudius-2? How did you find our encampment? Did you operate alone? …[br/][br/]Are you even listening? Stop staring at me like that!
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

But how could I not stare at you? You are an alien. My David… impersonated by an alien. And there I thought back on Atrium Beta that I must be the luckiest woman alive. While actually, I was only a fool.[br/][br/]A lost soul gazes into the black infinity of the cosmos…

But how could I not stare at you? You are an alien. My Sarah… impersonated by an alien. And there I thought back on Atrium Beta that I must be the luckiest man alive. While actually, I was only a fool.[br/][br/]A lost soul gazes into the black infinity of the cosmos…

Story message. Speaker: "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od". "David" and "Sarah" are the first names of the Vanguard (male and female) characters that were married to "James/Jane Henkins" (always heterosexual marriage assumed). "Atrium Beta" is the name of a planet.
…and the infinite eyes of the cosmos stare back.[br/][br/]You will get over it, Jane. But you won’t live long enough to savor any of that if you don’t answer my questions right now.
…and the infinite eyes of the cosmos stare back.[br/][br/]You will get over it, James. But you won’t live long enough to savor any of that if you don’t answer my questions right now.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Yes… of course. Though I wonder… did you really just complete the second verse from Codaly’s ‘New Metamorphoses’? I must have shown that book to you about two years ago. I guess you aliens really do pay attention to detail when you take over other people’s identities.

Story message. Speaker: "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od". "Codaly" is the last name of a Star Union author (race unspecified). "New Metamorphoses" is the name of an anthology of poetry.

But the questions, yes... The ship is wreckage. It got taken apart by Quartzite shortly after I landed. I came alone, following the faint aethron signature your - David’s - wedding ring has been emitting since you returned from Atrium Alpha.

But the questions, yes... The ship is wreckage. It got taken apart by Quartzite shortly after I landed. I came alone, following the faint aethron signature your - Sarah’s - wedding ring has been emitting since you returned from Atrium Alpha.
Story message. Speaker: "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od".

The wedding ring, of course! I should have thrown that damn thing away the moment I left the apartment. Would have saved me dealing with you again, Jane. But you are lucky. Despite your foolishness you may live to see another day.

The wedding ring, of course! I should have thrown that damn thing away the moment I left the apartment. Would have saved me dealing with you again, James. But you are lucky. Despite your foolishness you may live to see another day.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Gravitational particle density rising. High energy signature detected. ELOP Rift Reactor in range. Calibrating sono-recorders to match the target frequency.[br/][br/]Transmission in progress…
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Recon" (Shakarn mechanical unit, genderless)

…but that still doesn’t explain what a Bulwark was doing in the female worker toilet of lab compound alpha, Director. In the worker toilet! The first scientist to go in there today almost suffered a heart attack when she switched on the light.
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Bulwark" is the name of a Dvar in game unit. "Director" is the title of Dvar Consortium leaders.

Standard DV-R safety regulation. In the shaft, nobody wants to be unprepared in case of a Quartzite incursion or meteor shower. Your workers will get used to these new labor conditions. If we Dvar hadn’t paid attention to details like this during the post-Redcore era, there would be no comrades left to work in the mines anymore.
Story message. Speaker: "Stanizoid Zhelezo" (Dvar, male) "Redcore" is the name of the mining super-company during Star Union times that the Dvar originate from.

But this isn’t a mine, Director! And Celaudius-2 is no asteroid. When First Minister Tholian told me that a Dvar Consortium would join the Egalitarian League of Planets and send a detachment to support our goals on Celaudius-2, I thought you would provide us with safety, not with safety hazards!
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Egalitarian League of Planets" is the name of an intergalactic alliance, see the corresponding Glossary entry.

A Bulwark is only a safety hazard to the enemies of the Zhelezo Dvar, Colonel. As my second cousin and former leader of our Consortium Korvin likes to say…[br/][br/](The transmission ends, as the Recon is falling back to avoid detection.)
Story message. Speaker: "Stanizoid Zhelezo" (Dvar, male) "Korvin" refers to "Korvin Zhelezo", a male Dvar character. "Recon" is the name of the Shakarn scout unit.
So, the Dvar are making a move to join the ELOP Confederation? How very interesting. Considering the quarrels this is causing already, this could very well be something we can use to our advantage.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "ELOP Confederation" is a short form of "Egalitarian League of Planets", see the glossary entry.

Approaching continuative ELOP premises. Defensive Dvar fortifications are still in the process of being set up. The reactors themselves are mostly manned and operated by Vanguard. No subjects of elevated interest in range.[br/][br/]Stand by for further updates.
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Recon" (Shakarn mechanical unit, genderless) "ELOP" is a short form of "Egalitarian League of Planets", see the glossary entry.
Entering high security area. Matching gravitational shear patterns to avoid detection. Limited time frame.[br/][br/]Located subjects of elevated interest. Transmission in progress…
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Recon" (Shakarn mechanical unit, genderless)

…going too far, Huy. When the Dvar signaled their first interest in our continuous cooperation offers, we all knew there would be a few bumpy roads on that ride. But overcoming these kinds of problems is what the ELOP Confederation is all about.
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Huy" refers to "Huy Jiang", a male Vanguard character.

This may be true when there is a genuine interest to cooperate from everybody involved. But so far, the only thing the Dvar have shown interest in is laying claims to our resources and stealing the latest industrial and military ELOP blueprints.

With your past spy experience, you too should know better than to blindly trust the Dvar, Daiyu. Even more so when nobody has ever seen what truly rests inside their metal suits. For all we know…[br/][br/](The transmission is cut again, as the Recon moves back into a safer area.)
Oh, sweet distrust, wellspring to poison even the most fertile soil.[br/][br/]This is going to be a cakewalk!
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Continued survey report: There are a total of five Rift Reactors surrounding the artificial Void anomaly. The reactors work autonomously and will need to be shut down one by one.[br/][br/]Stand by for further updates.
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Recon" (Shakarn mechanical unit, genderless)

Placing Recon Buoy in Dvar production line cart. Self-destruct mechanisms will activate upon detection.[br/][br/]Inner smelter complex reached. Located subjects of elevated interest. Transmission in progress…
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Recon" (Shakarn mechanical unit, genderless) "Recon Buoy" is the name of a unit ability of the Shakarn Recon unit.

…trust you with this task, Baroness Valjura. The entrenchment around the reactors is making good progress. But to turn Celaudius-2 into an authentic fortress worthy of Dvar making, we need to bolster our defenses in other places as well.
Story message. Speaker: "Stanizoid Zhelezo" (Dvar, male) "Baroness" is a Dvar title. "Valjura" is the first name of a female Dvar character.

I am in total agreement, Director. The second continent is begging for proper Dvar fortifications. My party will start setting up new defensive perimeters within the ruins of Deliz Waspowa. From there, we…[br/][br/](The buoy has entered the smelter furnace. Shortly after, the transmission ends.)
Story message. Speaker: "Valjura Zhelezo" (Dvar, female) "Deliz Waspowa" is the name of a city and in game sector of this mission.
Deliz Waspowa. What a perfect opportunity to set up an ambush. They will not realize what struck them until it’s too late!
Story message. Speaker: "Kudat Rotak" (Shakarn, male) "Deliz Waspowa" is the name of a city and in game sector of this mission.

No! We cannot risk direct enemy contact without further preparations. The first step has to be sabotaging their communication devices. Once they are unable to call for help and expose us, we can strike. Afterwards, one of our agents will take on the identity of the Dvar party leader and return with the report of an unfortunate accident…
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Bah, you should have more faith in the quick raiding skills of the Domok, General.[br/][br/]But very well, we’ll peel the humans before we eat them.

Steal the identities of the Dvar detachment party, to infiltrate and sabotage the Rift Reactor Alpha. Before engaging the Dvar party, make sure to sabotage their communication devices or your cover might get compromized.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: you need to research Daemon Deployment from the Synthesis military research tree to unlock the [hyperlink,000003B5000000E6]Internal System Overload Hack[/hyperlink] operation.)[recommendedcol/]
Internal System Overload Hack operation used
An objective short form description. "Internal System Overload Hack" is the name of a strategic operation in the game.
Send a Zardas agent to update his holo projector with the specifications of the taken out Dvar hero. With this new identity he can infiltrate the enemy.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Who shall I be today? Who’s gonna be my vest? In the right light, a king can be a beggar and a war machine a crest. A simple upload to the holo projector and a scan…
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission)

…will transform this Shakarn into a different man. Well, or woman in this case.[br/][br/]Imitating the Dvar is the best. No mimic to match. No emotions to conceal. Just pretend to be a walking tin can.

Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission) Impersonating "Valjura Zhelezo"
Director Stanizoid… ambushed by lizard people… defensive protocol R9-DV red!

Baroness Valjura! No![br/][br/]Comrades of the Zhelezo Consortium, stand strong. This is the moment we’ve been preparing for. Let the Excavators ready their cannons and the Trenchers man the ditch. This is war!
Story message. Speaker: "Stanizoid Zhelezo" (Dvar, male) "Excavator" and "Trencher" are the names of in game Dvar units.
An alien ambush? This is grave news, Director. My troopers are already entering overwatch. We are in this together!
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "overwatch" is the name of an in game combat mechanic.
Great work, Marshal. So much for our stealth plans…
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Director Stanizoid… ambushed by the Amazon… are not… protocol R9-… red!
I’m happy to record that “Baroness Valjura” has plunged into another work accident. The void reactor didn’t take the induction with preheated PyrX plasma too well…
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission)

Excellent work, agent. This is how a Zardas inside job is done right.[br/][br/]With the first reactor down, our enemies will be alerted and we have to lie low. Fortunately, there are others on this world that can do our dirty work: The Therians look like they could be easily enough tricked into attacking the ELOP reactors.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

And how exactly are we going to accomplish that, General? By asking them nicely?[br/][br/]I say we put an end to this scheming charade and use raw military might to subdue the Therians. Once those bunnies tremble in fear, they will hop at whatever targets we give them.
I suppose you are right, Marshal. Obtaining the trust of the Therians would delay our operations for too long. We should take the more direct approach, this time.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
The attack of the Therians will be much fiercer if we present to them a truly despicable enemy. Obtaining their trust may take some effort and time, but it will spare us getting our own hands dirty.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Subdue the Therian Dwelling and force them to attack and destroy the Rift Reactor Beta.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

Eek, nasty lizard people, slaughtering our pack mates like pigs! That’s no nice way of going down the rabbit hole.[br/][br/]You want our provisions? Here, take this acorn bomb! And that one! And that…
Story message. Speaker: "Therian Chemist" (Therian unit, male)

Enough, puny pirates! You are all under occupation of the Scarlet Scepter. Follow our orders, and you will live. Show dissent, and you will face the meat grinder.[br/][br/]We have a task for you. The target is a human research station. Attack it, and you can earn your freedom.
Instigate the Therians to attack and destroy the Rift Reactor Beta. To be able to do so, however, you will have to earn their trust first.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
We saw you run with the pack, {STR_LeaderName}, heard your warning of a kharag in wolf’s clothing. What is this new threat that you say is skulking our borders?
Story message. Speaker: "Therian Prowler" (Therian unit, male) "Kharag" is the name of a monster unit from Age of Wonders 2.

The Vanguard and Dvar are trying to tear this planet apart. They have set up a series of reactors that distort reality, spreading the Void on Celaudius-2. We would try to stop them ourselves, but the reactors are heavily defended and our forces spread thin…
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Owoooo! Conventional defenses won’t stop a Prowler and his instincts. Hopping off to new planets whenever another disaster happens is fun for only so long. In the past, we’ve settled with howling at the moon. Maybe it’s time to also take it.
Story message. Speaker: "Therian Prowler" (Therian unit, male) "Kharag" is the name of a monster unit from Age of Wonders 2.
The Therians did it! That’s another reactor down. What’s the status of your holo projector, agent? Are you ready to go in again?
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

I am always prepared and ready to take on new identities, General. But may I suggest that we conduct some counter-intelligence before moving in for the next void reactor?[br/][br/]The enemy is still on the alert, and there may be traps laid out that we need to learn about.
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission)
I like the way you think, agent. By infiltrating the ELOP operation centers, we will greatly improve the efficiency of our sabotage operations.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "infiltrating the operation centers" refers to the in game strategic operation "Infiltrate Operations Center".

Weaken the internal defenses of the Dvar and Vanguard commanders by succesfully using the Infiltrate Operations Center covert operation on them. Then your agents can safely continue their acts of sabotage.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: you need to research Intelligence Gathering to unlock the Infiltrate Operations Center covert operation. To be able to use a covert operation on a player you need to meet that player first.)[recommendedcol/]
Infiltrate Operations Center successfully used on Daiyu Jiang
A task description. "Infiltrate Operations Center" is the name of a strategic operation in the game.
Infiltrate Operations Center successfully used on Stanizoid Zhelezo
A task description. "Infiltrate Operations Center" is the name of a strategic operation in the game.
There goes the third reactor. Your quickness surprises me, agent. I was not expecting you to move in for your next strike until in another couple of days.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

An opportunity came up. I took it. Let’s just say the humans have a surprisingly high tolerance for risky behavior when it happens within their own ranks.[br/][br/]Somebody thought it would be funny to have a dimensional rift connect their reactor desk with the fridge… Now they know it’s not.
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission)

Brilliant. If you keep this up, I can foresee a great future for you, agent.[br/][br/]As for the mission at hand, we should take another step back. We need a new scapegoat. The Paragon would be the next logical choice, but winning them over is always a tedious task.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Maybe… I can be of help with that. I may not be an expert in disguises like your friend, but my family used to do a lot of business with the Paragon. There are names and contacts I could use to put in some weight for your cause. Just let me talk to the Paragon in person.
Story message. Speaker: "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od".
So you can escape to their Dwelling and betray us? Nice try, wimp![br/][br/]Now move along and return to your cell before I lose my temper and personally throw you into the meat grinder.

No, wait! I’m serious. I give you my word that I will not reveal any information or attempt to escape if you let me negotiate with the Paragon. I have been thinking about it for some time. Despite everything, {STR_LeaderName} is still the closest thing left resembling my husband. I have no intention of running away from him.

No, wait! I’m serious. I give you my word that I will not reveal any information or attempt to escape if you let me negotiate with the Paragon. I have been thinking about it for some time. Despite everything, {STR_LeaderName} is still the closest thing left resembling my wife. I have no intention of running away from her.
Story message. Speaker: "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od".

How very touching. But you do realize, Jane, that none of what you do will change anything about you being our prisoner or the nature of our relationship – which is nonexistent – and that you will be betraying your people by helping us?

How very touching. But you do realize, James, that none of what you do will change anything about you being our prisoner or the nature of our relationship – which is nonexistent – and that you will be betraying your people by helping us?
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

I can’t believe that you are actually considering letting the human wander off, General. Give me a handful armed Domok and some preparation time, and I will make the Paragon beg me to let them serve us.
Very well, Marshal. You can have your campaign against the Paragon. There are too many unreliable variables involved in the other plan.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Stay your hands from that rifle trigger, Marshal. At least for now. I am too intrigued by the situation and want to see how this one will play out.[br/][br/]Here’s your chance, Jane. Show us why we should not have to keep you in a prison cell.

Stay your hands from that rifle trigger, Marshal. At least for now. I am too intrigued by the situation and want to see how this one will play out.[br/][br/]Here’s your chance, James. Show us why we should not have to keep you in a prison cell.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
May I make a suggestion, General? Though I must warn that it may be too morbid for your taste.
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission)
Speak your mind, agent. All is fair in love and war.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

It’s very fitting that you would respond with such a sentiment, General. You see, when we captured your human contact, I studied our data base to learn more about this potential threat. Jane Henkins’ family had many past dealings with the Paragon. If I take on her identity, I can surely manipulate them for our goals.

It’s very fitting that you would respond with such a sentiment, General. You see, when we captured your human contact, I studied our data base to learn more about this potential threat. James Henkins’ family had many past dealings with the Paragon. If I take on his identity, I can surely manipulate them for our goals.
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission)
Gah, all these talks about scheming and manipulation are making me sick! Give me a handful armed Domok and some preparation time, General, and I will make the Paragon beg me to let them serve us.

Stay your hands from that rifle trigger, Marshal. At least for now. I am too intrigued by the situation and want to see how this one will play out.[br/][br/]Here’s your chance, agent. Show us your impression of Jane Henkins.

Stay your hands from that rifle trigger, Marshal. At least for now. I am too intrigued by the situation and want to see how this one will play out.[br/][br/]Here’s your chance, agent. Show us your impression of James Henkins.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Subdue the Paragon Dwelling and force them to attack and destroy the Rift Reactor Delta.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Accursed alien invaders… we Paragon will never surrender to your empire!
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Fanatic" (Paragon unit, male)

Ha! We’ve heard that many times before. The Narrn, the Syron, or even the Rhajitsu. In the end they all succumbed to our will.[br/][br/]Now get going and bring me your Prefect. He has an announcement to make.

Story message. Speaker: "Kudat Rotak" (Shakarn, male) "Narrn" and "Rhajitsu" are the names of fictional races invaded by the Shakarn. "Syron" is the name of a race invaded by the Shakarn and the name of a race in Age of Wonders Shadow Magic. "Prefect" is a Paragon title.
Allow your human prisoner to negotiate with the Paragon and convince them to attack the Rift Reactor Delta.
Send your agent to negotiate with the Paragon and convince them to attack the Rift Reactor Delta.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Sabotage Rift Reactor Delta: "Hounds" of the Paragon
Defend yourself against the released prisoners of the Paragon.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Hail to the Prefect of Azus Cadora! Tell him that the chairman of Henkins & Sons has come to talk with him about a business proposition.

Story message. Speaker can be either "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od") or "Shakarn Infiltrator" impersonating "James/Jane Henkins" (this second option should work with the same translations, as he would also imitate to be of the same gender). "Azus Cadora" is the name of the Paragon Dwelling on the map. "Henkins & Sons" is the name of a family business.

Henkins & Sons? Never heard of that! You pirate scum are getting more brash by the minute. If only I could release the hounds on you.[br/][br/]Oh, wait, I can! At least those blood-crazed beast-people we captured should come close enough…
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Fanatic" (Paragon unit, male)
Uh oh, that didn’t go too well. {STR_LeaderName}?[br/][br/]Anyone?[br/][br/]Help!
Story message. Speaker: "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od".)
It looks like we have a problem here, General. Reinforcements would be appreciated…
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission)
Did you like this, pirate scum? There is more where that came from…
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Fanatic" (Paragon unit, male)

Enough! First, no one tells me of Henkins & Sons sending a delegation to visit our Dwelling. And then I find them welcomed by you in the worst possible manner! You are dismissed, soldier. Do not think this will not have consequences.
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Technoprophet" (Paragon unit, male)
As for you, my dear friend, how can we make you forget this injustice brought upon you by my soldiers? Name any favor, and it shall be granted.
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Technoprophet" (Paragon unit, male)

Thank you, Prefect. I am glad to see that the name of my family still has some weight among the Paragon.[br/][br/]When speaking of favors, I do already have something in mind that should benefit us both…

Story message. Speaker can be either "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od") or "Shakarn Infiltrator" impersonating "James/Jane Henkins" (this second option should work with the same translations, as he would also imitate to be of the same gender). "Azus Cadora" is the name of the Paragon Dwelling on the map. "Henkins & Sons" is the name of a family business.
The wimp is dead. Time for the cavalry to take over!
Fine. Just remember to keep some of the Paragon alive for the attack, Marshal.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
The Paragon obeyed and took down the reactor, General. Just as I said they would. At the core they are little more than rotting liches, clutching at their last spark of life.
I’ve got to hand it to this Prefect, he is a man of his word. The Paragon took the Delta Reactor down in no time.
Story message. Speaker: "James/Jane Henkins" (Vanguard, can be male or female depending on the gender of "Naranga Od". Always has the opposite gender of "Naranga Od".)

Kaboom, kablam! That’s another reactor in ruins – and another human successfully fooled. Even with all their neural implants the Paragon can still be as easily deceived. No wonder their empire collapsed…
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission)

Good work. This leaves us with one final reactor to sabotage, and generally in a very good position. Our ELOP enemies on the other hand are in a dilemma. They need to protect the last reactor, but ran out of people to assign to its defense that they could fully trust.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
One of our listening posts from within the ELOP HQ has delivered fresh news, General: The Vanguard commander is sending her first Lieutenant on a mission to Lunascent City.
Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Hacker" (Shakarn Synthesis unit, female) "Lieutenant" is a military title of the Vanguard. "Lunascent City" is the name of a ruined city and sector on this map.

What perfect timing! Almost too perfect, I might add... If we take this Lieutenant out and steal his identity, our agents will be all set to go in for the last reactor. But we need to act with the uttermost caution when we engage him.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Steal the identities of the Vanguard detachment party, to infiltrate and sabotage the Rift Reactor Epsilon. Before engaging the Vanguard party, make sure to sabotage their comunication devices or your cover might get compromized.
Internal System Overload Hack operation used
A task description. "Internal System Overload Hack" is the name of an in game strategic operation.
Send a Zardas agent to update his holo projector with the specifications of the taken out Vanguard hero. With this new identity he can infiltrate the enemy.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Is there someone strange[br/]In your neighborhood[br/]Who’s it gonna be?[br/]Infiltrators!

Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission) The text is a reference to the title song of "Ghostbusters".
Someone you once knew[br/]Looking not so good[br/]Now he’s been replaced[br/]Infiltrators!

Story message. Speaker: "Shakarn Infiltrator" (Shakarn unit, but also a specific reuccring male character in this mission, his name only gets revealed in the next mission) Impersonating "Huy Jiang" The text is a reference to the title song of "Ghostbusters".
Watch out, Aunt Daiyu… ambushed by the Amazon… behind everything…
Huy, no! Why did I let him scout ahead into hostile territory like this? I curse you, Matron – or whatever your actual title is!
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Matron" is a title of the Amazon.

We had an interplanetary transmission this morning, talking to the real Creusa of Oran. She told us what this Dvar had suspected from the very beginning: there had never been any terraforming shipment sent out to Thanakiwa. Amazon hag!
Story message. Speaker: "Stanizoid Zhelezo" (Dvar, male) "Creusa of Oran" is the name of an Amazon female character that Naranga Od is impersonating in this mission (see dialogues further below).
Yes! Our agent pulled through. This should be the final cut for the ELOP reactor and its rift.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
I hate to say this, General, but I’ll admit that your plan to use sabotage turned out to be a lot… less awful than I expected. I shouldn’t have doubted you the way I did.
Less… awful? Didn’t you mean to say brilliant? Fabulous?
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Argh, don’t push it, General. Just seize the moment of triumph while it lasts.[br/][br/]Speaking of victories, shouldn’t the void rift have collapsed by now?

There you go, Marshal. It was just politely waiting for you to ask.[br/][br/]Hmm, but what is this? The dispersing anomaly has revealed a new structure – the authentic reactor core! All this time it had been hidden inside the Void!
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Heh. Those humans are smarter than I gave them credit for. Not that it will do them much good, though. Permission to move out and destroy the reactor core from within, General. Let’s grill our enemies while they’re still marinated.

Permission granted, Marshal, and take your best soldiers with you. I don’t want the ELOP commanders to get any time to repair their facilities. Make this one count. For the Domok! And for the Shakarn!
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)

Hidden in the Void anomaly, the complex core of the Rift Reactor is still keeping the ELOP defensive Void Storms active. Now that the outer ring of that anomaly has been dispersed, we need to shut down the reactor core before the rest of the facility can be repaired.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: you need a hero present at an anomalous site such as this to progress through its events.)[/recommendedcol]
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

This is Colonel Daiyu Jiang of the Egalitarian League of Planets. Unidentified forces, be warned that you are trespassing on restricted military territory and that continued advances will be met with gunfire. Identify yourselves!

Oh, blessings of the Mother! Finally, a kindred soul to help us on our hunt. We are the survivors of an Amazon convoy carrying terraforming equipment to Thanakiwa. After our ship was hit by a Void Storm, we had to make an emergency landing on this moon.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character. "Thanakiwa" is the name of a planet.
To Thanakiwa? Then you must be from the Neogalactic Sisterhood. It is a rare occasion to see someone of your faction seek contact with outsiders. Which means you are either very desperate – or spies.
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Neogalactic Sisterhood" is the name of an empire (Amazon only, so all female).
Well spoken, Colonel. When the eco-fanatics and their savage beasts send a crewed ship to Celaudius-2, it is surely to undermine our operations. They need to be kept away from this side of the moon!
“Aren’t the Dvar the ones to usually undermine others, Director?”
“Is this the famous open-mindedness of the ELOP Confederation?”
“Neogalactic Sisterhood? You are making things up!”
Insulting my comrades will not divert from your ill intentions, Amazon hag. It would be best to return to your cauldron and leave. We will be keeping a bulwark’s eye on you.
Story message. Speaker: "Stanizoid Zhelezo" (Dvar, male) "Bulwark" is the name of a Dvar unit.

You must understand our skepticism, Amazon Matron. After the failed negotiation-attempts with your people, only a small splinter group ended up joining the ELOP Confederation. That you show up as a refugee at one of our restricted military test sites seems like a suspicious coincidence.

We will have to check whether your story adds up with our own sources. If it does you can be assured that we will grant you the hospitality you deserve.[br/][br/]In the meantime, please keep your distance. We will get back to you.

Haha! The Amazon spy is confused by her own lies. Your sisterhood wants to “save” planets. Tell them this one is already all safe and fortified and that they can let off their environmental steam in the darkest corner of the universe!

I know that you would love to toy with the humans for as long as possible, General. But keep in mind that they aren’t complete idiots. They have sensors and their own scouts and spies that will find our secret installations eventually. It is therefore only a matter of time until our cover will be blown.

Creusa of Oran? That’s your name, Matron, isn’t it? We need your help. There was an accident in one of our facilities and we are currently investigating the scene. The engineer involved had last been on a field mission in the ruins of Lunascent City. Did your huntresses notice anything unusual when scouting that area?
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Lunascent City" is the name of a ruined city and a sector on the map.
Mention the Resupply Station and the Paragon
A story dialogue choice option. "Resupply Station" is the name of a structure on the world map.
Mention the Therians and Deliz Waspowa
A story dialogue choice option. "Deliz Waspowa" is the name of a ruined city and sector on the map.

We did find a still intact Resupply Station when we moved through Lunascent City. Maybe your engineer got into a conflict with the Paragon there. They often desperately sift through any old facilities that could still contain replacements for their failing implants.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.

My sisters didn’t survey the area you mentioned yet. However, they did report a gang of Therian Chemists heading in the direction of Deliz Waspowa. Their acorn bombs can have the strangest side effects, I heard…
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character. "Chemist" is the name of a Therian unit.
My sisters did survey Lunascent City, but didn’t find anything worthy of mention. I am sorry that we cannot be of more help to you, Colonel.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.
I see. This puts the entire situation into a different light. Thank you, Matron. We will stay in contact.
I see. Any new information would have been welcome, but we will get to the bottom of this regardless. Thank you, Matron. We will stay in contact.
The human is clever. She pretends to need our help, when she actually only wants us to get caught up in contradictions.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
You know my stand point on this, General. My Raiders are always prepared to strike. Just say the word.

So, we cross the same peak again, tree girl. The Therians invaded our shafts yesterday, killing many of my comrades. This Dvar thinks that someone put these feral beast people up to this rampage. Somebody with a talent for handling animals...

We would be fools to let any of our beasts attack a fully-armed Dvar Bulwark, Director. Going against the complete defenses of the galaxy’s masters of fortification would be suicide.[br/][br/]Besides, the Therians have their own will. They are free people.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.
If we had sent those Therians, Stanizoid Zhelezo, you would be dead. It is dangerous to seek out enemies like you do, Director.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.

Your Consortium has grown weak, Director, if it can’t defend against a few roaming pirates. Trying to cover this debility by questioning the integrity of my people is an outrage that calls for actions! Stanizoid Zhelezo, I challenge you to a Settlement!

Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character. "Settlement" is the name of a Dvar tradition to resolve a grudge between rivaling Consortia by their leaders facing each other in a special fighting arena.
You show some iron logic here, tree girl. But maybe this is exactly why you didn’t send your own creatures after us. You sent the Therians. And now you think compliments can make us lower our guard.
Unbelievable! The Amazon hag even admits it herself! This will have consequences, Creusa of Oran. It isn’t over yet!

Heh! I did not expect any Amazon woman to show such spirit. I can see that the fame of our noble traditions has travelled far. Unfortunately, customs forbid me to face anyone who isn’t Dvar inside the settlement arena. But we could meet up for an honest brawl, another day perhaps.

Greetings, Creusa of Oran. There have been more accidents, which makes me turn to you for help again, Matron. You see, some of our facilities require specific spare parts for their repairs. We believe that there may be useful pieces among the terraforming supplies you’ve been shipping. Do you think we can reach an agreement to let us search them for something compatible?

We would love to be of help to you, Colonel. Unfortunately, Therian raiders surprised us when we were still in chaos after the emergency landing. They took all the terraforming supplies. We were barely able to protect our critical food reserves and colony infrastructure.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.

I’m sorry to hear about your losses, Matron. Sadly, we had similar experiences with the Therians. Something on Celaudius-2 has turned them a lot more aggressive. They used to be civilized people. We will have to solve our reactor problem in a different way, then.

I hate to be in this situation, but I’m afraid that I am not authorized to exchange any technology with you, Colonel. Our terraforming equipment could be used to devastating effects if it fell into the wrong hands. Therefore, we prefer to keep things more… private.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.

I see. That is very unfortunate, and somewhat short-sighted considering that you came to us with a plea for help in the first place. You know how the saying goes: you scratch my back... [br/][br/] But we will have to solve our reactor problem in a different way then.
We would love to be of help to you, Colonel. Unfortunately, the entire terraforming shipment was destroyed during the emergency landing. There is nothing left that could be of use to you.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.

I’m sorry to hear about your losses, Matron. It’s a fortunate thing that at least your provisions and colony infrastructure made it down in one piece. We will have to solve our reactor problem in a different way then.

Another day, another suspect, tree girl. This time the Paragon came knocking at our defenses. We taught them the meaning of the word ‘explosive’. They never bothered us before, so somebody must have instigated them. Someone they couldn’t resist, or should I rather say whose female charms bewitched them?

Look, Director of the Zhelezo Dvar. If you are wanting a date with me, you should have just asked me directly. In some cases, the mating rituals of other species can be a fascinating study. But so far, I’m unimpressed.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.
This is… absurd! I would have never… and generally there is nothing wrong with a middle-aged Dvar not having his own wife and children! Just ask the Director of the Gorodin Consortium.
Story message. Speaker: "Stanizoid Zhelezo" (Dvar, male) "Gorodin" is the name of a Dvar Consortium and the last name of "Nikael Gorodin", a male Dvar character.

So, the Paragon did something unexpected, and this is the best explanation that your bird brain could come up with, Director? I am amazed. This is exactly why species are better off without a male gender.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.

Ridiculous! Without us men to take the lead, you’d all still be sitting in a stone cave, thinking about how to best decorate the walls.[br/][br/]Deny it all you want, Creusa of Oran. I will get to the bottom of your sneaky schemes eventually!

You have a vivid imagination, Director. Besides, why would anybody want to waste her feminine powers on some brain-dead zombies, when there is a formidable Dvar in his mighty suit waiting just one continent away…
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Creusa of Oran", a female Amazon character.
Back off, you man-eating monster! I will never fall into your traps! The Vanguard Colonel said that I was going crazy, but now there is no doubt that my theory was true!

Your actions don’t surprise us anymore, Matron – or whatever your actual title is. We had an interplanetary transmission this morning, talking to the real Creusa of Oran. You can imagine how this conversation was a true eye-opener for us in the most literal sense.
She told us what this Dvar had suspected from the very beginning: there had never been any terraforming shipment sent out to Thanakiwa. Amazon hag!

Assuming we are actually dealing with an Amazon here, Director. Which neatly brings up the next question on the list. If you are not Creusa of Oran and you haven’t been sent by the Neogalactic Sisterhood, who and what are you?

What’s the matter Daiyu? Don’t you recognize your Empress anymore? Did you not want to thank me for liberating our people from CORE, for executing what your pathetic First Minister would have never dared to consider?
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Empress Carminia".
A short slumber on a stretcher. Ehhh, gawek! We cut you open and waste your soul in a game of interdimensional poker. You will only feel a slight sting. Hooonk, eh ehh!
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating a "Dire Penguin", an in game unit.

The man, the legend, the Mah Reg’Nib. You may have heard my stories, read my many reports. You asked yourself, who is this person that seems to have appeared at so many key events throughout centuries of Star Union history? Can there really be only one Mah Reg’Nib or is he the voice of the people that need to be heard?

Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Mah Reg'Nib", a supposedly male character of unknown race and origin, who is the source for many unit descriptions and tech quotes in the game.
No, I don’t believe you. You are still hiding your true nature. I can see it in your eyes. They are mocking us, studying us, continuing their game of deception.

Maybe you are right, Colonel, and I am not who I told you to be. Maybe everything you perceive is just an illusion and the universe is composed of entities that would defy your understanding of physics in every meaningful way.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating "Daiyu Jiang".
I could be a living crystal…
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating a "Quartzite Crystal Worm" unit.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
… or even a bacterium inside the stomach of a Tyrannodon.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating a "Xenoplague Pustule" unit.
Or how about a data block on a hard disk, compiled from binary code?
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating a "Synthesis Avatar" unit.

That’s it, of course: you are using holograms to alter your appearance! How else could you change to so many different forms and sizes! But why are you doing all this? Why sabotage our reactors and wage a de-facto war on the ELOP Confederation?
You will find out soon enough, human. You will find out soon enough.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) Impersonating an "Autonom Justicar" unit.

That’s the last reactor down! I have to admit, Marshal, that your brute force methods turned out to work better than I expected. It is a good thing you showed persistence even when I discarded your ideas.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Don’t mention it, General. You did well in weighing all options. It’s what a good Gama needs to do.[br/][br/]But before we celebrate victory, shouldn’t the Void Rift already have collapsed by now?

With all the reactors down, there is an interesting new development going on over there at the ELOP headquarters, General. One of our listening posts is transmitting live voice recordings to us. You probably want to hear this.

…have known a disaster like this would happen. My nephew warned me about you from the very beginning. Now he is dead and the most important defensive ELOP project at the verge of critical failure. I have no choice but to drive you and your Dvar away from Celaudius-2, Director.
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Nephew" refers to Huy Jiang, a male Vanguard character.

This is an outrage! Our Consortium has invested blood, sweat and machines in this cause, vouching with their lives for your safety. And this is how you repay us? Don’t think we’ll be leaving behind even a scrap of metal that we brought for construction, Colonel. Interfere with our dismounting processes and there will be war!
In that case, you better ready your Bulwarks, Director! These deconstruction plans are just another ruse to buy you the time needed to finish your acts of sabotage. I will not let…
Victory doesn’t get any sweeter than this. With the ELOP commanders at each other’s throats, shutting down the reactor core will be little more than a formality…
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Take the Rift Reactor Alpha by force and destroy it.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Keep them coming, General. My troops and I are just getting started.
Take the Rift Reactor Beta by force and destroy it.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Another great victory for the Domok and the Scarlet Scepter! This is my way of doing diplomacy, General.
Take the Rift Reactor Gamma by force and destroy it.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
There they say there are problems that cannot be solved with an omni rifle. Fools!
Take the Rift Reactor Delta by force and destroy it.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
This is a day for Prokarn to remember! It’s only in the heat of battle that true heroes can be forged!
Take the Rift Reactor Epsilon by force and destroy it.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Sound the invasion, soldiers! Tonight, we light up the heavens!
That’s it! The reactor core is shutting down. Orbital sensors are confirming that the ELOP Void Storms have started to collapse on themselves.
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female)
Well done, General! This marks a day for future Shakarn generations to remember. They will all study the sonoscript from the moment we rang in the invasion of the Star Union.

Now, before you do the honors and contact the Scarlet Scepter, you should choose your weapons for the upcoming war. During this mission our troops got their hands on enough tech to offer you something with a little bit more of a punch.
Follow the Call of the Abyss (Switch to Psynumbra)
Thank you, Marshal. You are right: the play time is over. Now we ignite the fires from which Shakarn heroes will be born.[br/][br/]Put me through to Chancellor Kor. We have a galaxy to conquer!
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "Chancellor" is a military title of the Shakarn. "Kor" is the last name of a male Shakarn character.

Thank you, Marshal. You are right: the play time is over. Now it is on us to use the Void that the ELOP was so happy to exploit.[br/][br/]Put me through to Chancellor Kor. We have a galaxy to conquer!
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "Chancellor" is a military title of the Shakarn. "Kor" is the last name of a male Shakarn character.
Thank you, Marshal. But I still have some Synthesis aces up my sleeve that I want to play during the upcoming conflicts.[br/][br/]Now put me through to Chancellor Kor. We have a galaxy to conquer!
Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "Chancellor" is a military title of the Shakarn. "Kor" is the last name of a male Shakarn character.
Thank you, Marshal. But I have decided to tap into a different source of power… The promise of Lohikarne awaits.[br/][br/]Now put me through to Chancellor Kor. We have a galaxy to conquer!

Story message. Speaker: "Naranga Od" (Shakarn, can be both male or female) "Lohikarne" is the name of a Psynumbra demon. "Chancellor" is a military title of the Shakarn. "Kor" is the last name of a male Shakarn character.
Disabling the other generators cleared the voidstorm obscuring this facility. Now you must seize control of this last station to conquer the facility and let the Shakarn fleet through.

As the void storms break open it reveals a sprawling facility. The enormous Void Reactor Core is embedded in the landscape and has clearly lost dimensional stability as result of the loss of the five anchoring reactor facilities. From where we’re standing now we can clearly see at least one point of entry: The front gate.

The front gate is guarded by a small force of Vanguard troops. Elites by the looks of it. We could take them head on no doubt, or we could find another way in. The provided schematics reveal this place was built on ruins and it would stand to reason some of the tunnels and sewers are still accessible.
The time for subtlety has passed, we charge head on! With a gutteral warcry our Domok reveal our presence. The Vanguard troops stand ready. Ready to die.
The Vanguard stand ready to defend the entrance, but they stand no chance against the might of the Shakarn.

The limp hand of a Vanguard soldier trails off the identification panel - dead like the rest of his comrades. Nothing but death comes the way of those who defy the Shakarn. The heavy door opens slowly. We push onward, for the glory of the Shakarn Empire.
Enter through the old ruins under the facility
The winding path below the facility is slow and long, but it hides us from those above and helped spare our energy. No doubt we will need it.
Access shafts used in construction allow us to enter undetected. As we emerge it is clear we are in the middle of the facility.
We're "convincing" the Therians to do some heavy lifting.

Whatever our envoy told these furry fools has incited a near mindless anger in them. With rage filled eyes and foam at the mouths they throw themselves onto the Vanguard with righteous fury. The last brute left standing is easily disposed of, allowing us easy and quick entry into the facility.

Once on the inside of the facility, we can clearly see its walls almost warping around us as the result of the dimensional destabilization. It takes mere moments to arrive at a crossroad where we can see three different corridors, all of them going deeper into the facility and all of them showing us twisted visions of different places. The first shows us Kadalos, our homeworld. Its streets are purple with blood. The second shows massive spires of old Star Union design unlike any we’ve seen before. The last shows darkness. Nothing but void.

Stepping into the corridor takes us right onto a battlefield; the blood, the cries, the deafening explosions of sono-weaponry. This is not present day Kadolos. This is the Second Segregation War. There’s barely any time to let the realization sink in as an explosion goes off close to us and we see a contingent of heavily armed Domok taking aim at us...
Phase_3_Choice_1_Start of an anomalous site. "Second Segragation War" is the name of a civil war that once happened on the Shakarn home world, Kadalos.
Stepping through the rift has left us on a Kadolos during the Second Segregation War, face-to-face with a contingent of heavily armed Domok seconds away from unleashing hell at us…

The opposing Domok fall to the superior tactics of united Shakarn forces but it’s hardly worth calling a victory. We find a way out, through another rift and back into the corridors of the Reactor facility. This is the price our ancestors paid for the schism between castes.

We emerge from the portal and find ourselves on what is undeniably Union Prime, back when the Star Union was still at its peak. Though none of us makes mention of it, we all stand marveling at the grand spires and architecture for a moment. A moment followed by confusion as the urban environment is nothing short of a maze.

The amazement at the grand construction is quickly replaced by annoyance when it takes us a long time to find our way through the sprawling maze of Union Prime. Finally, we found ourselves back outside the rift, re-emerging at the Reactor facility.

Only fools fear the dark - and we are no fools. Still, we see creatures move at the edge of our vision, we hear voices whisper promises of great power, and our hero says they were even offered the “Gift of Psynumbra” to help destroy our enemies. Despite finding our way out safely none of us can deny being unnerved.

Only fools fear the dark - and we are no fools. Still, we see creatures move at the edge of our vision, we hear voices whisper promises of great power, and our hero says they were even offered the “Gift of Psynumbra” to help destroy our enemies. As we emerge from the dark we find ourselves with fewer in number. Perhaps there is something to fear in this void after all…

We quickly determined our new position, and it is clear after a single glance that we are near the facility's core - only a set of massive doors bars our way now... Before we can do much more than take a step forward, a hologram springs to life. A hologram powered by Shakarn technology, displaying a human woman dressed in what can only be described as queenly regalia.
The warning we just received still weighs on our minds, but we have come too far to turn back now. We all know what must be done.
It is no threat, let it speak
